I - fan Distant organ injury Neutrophil Distant Systemic inflammatory activation recruitment organ injury Fig. 6. Paneth cells and intestinal mast cells release potent effectors to regulate local injury and systemic inflammation after intestinal ischemia/reperfusion. Most prominently, the Paneth cell-dependent pathway (blue) depends on release of interleukin (IL)-17 from Paneth cells localized at the base of small intestinal crypts. Mast cell responses (purple) use a number of preformed and de novo synthesized products such as proteases (tryptase, mast cell protease [MCP]-4), lipid mediators (leukotriens, pros- taglandins), and cytokines (tumor necrosis factor [TNF]-a, IL-6).
